name: Bernardia erecta

name: Bernardia stylosa

remarks: doi:10.1007/s12228-021-09670-z The specific epithet refers to the conspicuous erect, bifid styles with recurved branches.

name: Caperonia itapevae
typeLocations: holotype RB 01456010;isotype ECT;isotype ICN;isotype K;isotype MBM;isotype NY;isotype PEL;isotype SPF;isotype UPCB
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Torres, Parque Estadual de Itapeva, c. 5 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.633.1.4 Etymology: 'The specific epithet refers to Parque Estadual de Itapeva, in the indigenous Guarani language, Ita = rock, and peba = flat. Itapeva was the name given to the flat rock formation currently known as Pedra do Itapeva, in the protected area. Here, we use the specific epithet as a reference to the Parque Estadual de Itapeva and in honor of the Guarani indigenous people'.

name: Cleidion praealtum
distribution: Mun. Humayta, near Tres Casas, Amazonas (Brazil, Southern America)
